## MATHEMATICS

9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[730, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation \(\sec x = 2 - \frac{1}{2} x\) has exactly one root in the interval \(0 \leqslant x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 400, 143, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 415, 620, 437]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that this root lies between 0.8 and 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 419, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 636, 144, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 628, 920, 666]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = \cos^{- 1}\left(\frac{2}{4 - x_{n}}\right)\) to determine the root correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 662, 574, 682]]<|/det|>
Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 662, 920, 681]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 641, 109]]<|/det|>
Find \(\int_{\frac{1}{6}\pi}^{\frac{1}{3}\pi} x \sec^2 x \, \mathrm{d}x\). Give your answer in a simplified exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 100, 559, 134]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{1 + 4y^2}{\mathrm{e}^x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 140, 383, 159]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 172, 148, 190]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 171, 751, 190]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 171, 920, 190]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 85, 695, 307]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 327, 920, 380]]<|/det|>
In the diagram, \(OABCDEFG\) is a cuboid in which \(OA = 2\) units, \(OC = 3\) units and \(OD = 2\) units. Unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}, \mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\) are parallel to \(OA\), \(OC\) and \(OD\) respectively. The point \(M\) on \(AB\) is such that \(MB = 2AM\). The midpoint of \(FG\) is \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 394, 146, 413]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 393, 598, 413]]<|/det|>
Express the vectors \(\overrightarrow{OM}\) and \(\overrightarrow{MN}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{i}, \mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 395, 920, 413]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 603, 146, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 603, 579, 621]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line through \(M\) and \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 603, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\), the foot of the perpendicular from \(D\) to the line through \(M\) and \(N\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 106, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 574, 92]]<|/det|>
The complex numbers \(\nu\) and \(w\) satisfy the equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 98, 668, 119]]<|/det|>
\[\nu +\mathrm{i}w = 5\qquad \mathrm{and}\qquad (1 + 2\mathrm{i})\nu -w = 3\mathrm{i}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 125, 915, 144]]<|/det|>
Solve the equations for \(\nu\) and \(w\), giving your answers in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 141, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
(i) On an Argand diagram, sketch the locus of points representing complex numbers \(z\) satisfying \(|z - 2 - 3\mathrm{i}| = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 411, 196, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[198, 411, 650, 429]]<|/det|>
Calculate the least value of \(\arg z\) for points on this locus.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 411, 920, 428]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
